div1.p: Lawrence Reed gives post news and notes Truby's comments concerning the yellow fever experiments. He inquires if she will visit at Christmas. He turns twenty-three tomorrow.

div1.head: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, December 4, 1900
div1.p:
Your letter of the 25th reached me
yesterday morning and I was so glad to
learn that your yellow fever toe is much
better -- and I feel sure you will be
out bye the time this reaches you --

Things are about the same
with me that is my duties are not
at all hard, so I have lots of time
to myself

I think I have spoken of
our mess, well we have quite a large
one and each month we elect some
one to run it -- unfortunately they
selected me for December so I have
a job for this months, Thank Goodness
we have a 1stclass cook so with a
little thought I can recall the good
things you used to have and tell
him what I want- I have gotten along
fine for the 1st 3rd days-

The date for our wedding which
takes place Dec. 14 is drawing quite near
so this affords us much to talk
about-

Dont worry about the things
for I can get them without bothering
you-

I had a long letter from my
friend Humber who is at Niobrava he
is sorry that he is not here and
I feel as though I got the
better of him on the deal --

We had a fine time last
Friday evening, quite a party of us
went out to a dance Given by an
Englishman who owens and manages
one of the larges Sugar plantations
in Cuba- We danced for several hours
had a dandy supper and several good
songs and etc -- got home about 3.30
A.M.-

Dr Truby has arrived and says
he left Dad quite well and doing so nicely
with his experiments- He has been convinced
and I suppose will win us all in
time that the theory is the right one-

We are still enjoying the most
delightful weather and I suppose it
will keep this way for several months.

Have you decide whether or not you
are coming down Xmas? If you
dont I am going to try an get
Father to come over for a few days
to see me-

I am so pleased with the
people of this post they are all so
nice and really we have a dandy
good time-

By the way tomorrow
is my birthday to think I am
23 years of age- I truly feel
about 18- well there are lots of
men much older than I am in this
world that are not doing any better-
And dearest my present good fortune
is due entirely to Your's and Father's
good care and lesson taught me --
I may not appear to appreciate it but
I certainly do far more than I suppose
I say or act-

I am glad B is enjoying
herself- I am going to see if I cant
find her something for Xmas but I
fear I cant do much in Cienfuegos

Remember me to all my
friends and write me soon with
lots of love for your dear self and
Blossom I am your devoted son
